title: Windows 8.1 AIO x86 en-US WIM Oct2013
description:
murphy78 presents Windows 8.1 AIO x86 en-US WIM Oct2013
Contains KB files current to Oct8-2013 patch date

No Windows 8.1 Settings were harmed in the making of this ISO.
No Programs are added to Windows.
No Registry Settings were modified.
No Unattended Settings were added to the ISO.

en_windows_8_1_enterprise_n_x86_dvd_2791297.iso

Language: en-US (English - United States)

Tools used:
imagex for /flags "ProfessionalWMC" setting and index renames
dism for set-edition for ProWMC, KB integration, index exports
oscdimg for ISO mastering with MS's default -u1 option
Info folder added to Windows Setup folder to annoy credit theives

DISM /Add-Package kbfiles added:
KB2859675, KB2880289, KB2884101, KB2886439

Features:
-Modifiable install.wim format.

*Instructions*
1) Get the baseline version in the torrent url I mentioned above.
2) Get SmartVersion 3.0
3) Get this torrent
4) Cut/Paste the .SVF patch file from this torrent to the baseline folder
5) Open SmartVersion 3.0 and open the .svf patch from the baseline folder
6) Click the Export button (Book Stack Icon with Downward Arrow)
7) Enjoy your ISO and consider buying SmartVersion 3 if you like it.

Notes:
-Still no KMS offline activator for 8.1 (v6) at this point in time. It has
been done, but only using a specific host key. They'd need to randomize the
process, work around the localhost block issue, and a number of other things.
So far, they've just succeeded in reading HMAC from memory and using it in
their coding. We will likely see online KMS servers and VMs long before a
well-done refined solution like the one that started in MTK 2.4 happens.
Feel free to share online KMS Servers in the comments as they come online.
Make sure they support Windows 8.1's v6 protocol. To activate using those
servers you would open admin command prompt and run:

SLMGR /IPK xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx (gVLK KMS Key read win81-pkeys.txt)
SLMGR /SKMS www.some-server.net:1688 (mind the syntax, 1688 is default port)
SLMGR /ATO (Activate using your key and SKMS settings)

They've added KMS v6 protocol support to existing host systems with the new
patch file KB2885698. It's only a matter of time until people start hosting
VM servers that will activate everyone.

-ESD patches were too large. Using WIM patches for now.

-I recommend printing out the win81-pkeys.txt for installs. You can access
the one I put on the disk using shift-f10 during setup, navigating to the dvd
or USB Flash drive, and running "type win81-pkeys.txt" Then simply tab between
the command prompt and the key entry window.

Credits:
